title: Iranian Navy seized 2 US Navy maritime drones on Thursday
description: The Iranian Navy seized two US Navy maritime drones in international waters in the Red Sea on Thursday.

title: He fled the country and went into hiding. Why has Sri Lanka's deposed leader come back now?
description: After more than 50 days, he's back.

title: Pneumonia cases, including three deaths, with no clear cause under investigation in Argentina
description: Three people have died and several others in Argentina have become sick after developing pneumonia with no clear cause, the World Health Organization said Friday.

title: Yes, the unemployment rate rose. Here's why that's good news
description: On Friday, the Bureau of Labor Statistics reported that the US unemployment rate had ticked up to 3.7% in August, an increase that surprised economists who had expected it to remain at July's 3.5%.

title: Russia cuts off gas exports to Europe via Nord Stream indefinitely
description: • Opinion: Don't wake the nuclear giant on our doorstep

title: One of the world's most twisted towers unveiled in China
description: One of the world's most twisted towers has been unveiled in Chongqing, China.

title: Analysis: Queen Elizabeth signals nothing will stop her from carrying out her royal duties
description: We're back, royal readers, and in just a few days' time the new leader of the governing Conservative Party -- and consequently, the country's next prime minister -- will be announced. As you'll recall, the Queen and politics don't usually mix, but she is involved in the transition, so let's break it down.

title: A third of Pakistan is underwater amid its worst floods in history. Here's what you need to know
description: More than one third of Pakistan is underwater, according to satellite images from the European Space Agency (ESA), as deadly floodwaters threaten to create secondary disasters.

title: Frieze's inaugural Asian edition bets on South Korea as the region's next major art market
description: With its thriving local gallery scene and a growing class of affluent collectors, South Korea has long been considered one of the art world's sleeping giants. The announcement that a major art fair, Frieze, would launch its inaugural Asian edition there may have surprised some, but it was the culmination of decades of growth.

title: Experts Urge Americans to Refi Before the Next Fed Meeting
Myanmar's deposed former leader Aung San Suu Kyi sentenced to jail, hard labor
description: Myanmar's deposed former leader Aung San Suu Kyi was found guilty of electoral fraud on Friday and sentenced by a judge to three years in jail with hard labor, according to a source familiar with the proceedings.

title: Lukoil chairman dies after falling from a Moscow hospital window
description: The chairman of Russian oil and gas giant Lukoil has died after falling out of the window of a hospital in Moscow, according to Russian state media.

title: Argentina's Vice President Kirchner threatened with gun outside her home
description: Police in Argentina have arrested a man accused of pointing a gun at Vice President Cristina Fernández de Kirchner at point blank range outside her home in Buenos Aires on Thursday.

title: Starbucks names new CEO
description: Starbucks has tapped Laxman Narasimhan as its next CEO.

title: Iran's response to nuclear deal 'not constructive,' US State Department says
description: An effort to save the Iran nuclear deal appeared to hang in the balance on Thursday after Washington said Tehran's latest reply to the European Union proposal was "not constructive."
